views.markdown: Configure options from within the Settings App.See larger Screenshots below..

- Added Compatibility with iOS 10.3.3 Jailbreak - Version Compatible update Fixed Chrome crushing when trying to access the menu dropdown - Fixed YouTube videos downloading following their API change Version: 4.3.0
Changes:
• Fixed YouTube Vevo videos downloads
- Updated for iOS 10 compatibility - Fixed compatibility issues with iOS 8.
- Added support for some old versions of Chrome for users who can't run latest upgrades.
- Fixed YouTube and DailyMotion videos downloads on latest version of Chrome.
- Fixed "Tap and Hold" on a link option to download files.
- Fixed DailyMotion video downloads

- Fixed YouTube video downloads following API change - iOS 8.x bug fix

- Fixed compatibility with Chrome app in iOS 8.x - Fixed file download prompt following Chrome API change
- Enhanced compatibility with iOS 9.2 and 9.3.3 Jailbreak
- Fixed YouTube downloads following API change

- Fixed Chrome crashing when tapping the EDIT button in the downloads tab -Fix missing AppList dependency

- Detached the embedded Media Importer as a stand-alone app called Audicy available in Cydia with audio trimming capabilities and enhanced features.
- The previous Media Importer is still available as a basic version of Audicy which includes the old options.
- Fixed Vimeo videos no longer downloading
Version: 4.1.4-1
Fixed YouTube videos no longer downloading following API change
Fixed VEVO videos no longer downloading following API change
Compatibility fixes for latest version of Chrome app
Version: 4.1.3-2
- Fixed Chrome crashing when loading YouTube for users of iOS prior to 9.x

Version: 4.1.3-1
- Added support for downloading videos from the Chinese video website “Youku.com”.
- Youku support includes downloading multi parts videos in one go.
- Fixed Youtube videos no longer downloading following Youtube site API change.
- Fixed Vimeo videos no longer downloading following Vimeo site API change.
- Fixed the issue which causes searching for album artwork to yield only low resolution images.
Version: 4.1.2-1
Changes in this version:
- Fixed DailyMotion videos not downloading.
- Fixed the error of writing to preferences plist.
Version: 4.1.1-1

Changes in this version:
- Fixed CD+ downloading capabilities
- Fixed a bug where deleting a downloaded file causes Chrome app to crash.
- Fixed the pirated message some users were getting.
- CD+ no longer relies on symlink for saving downloaded files. You can now save files directly into any destination of your choice and easily access them. You may experience difficulty playing existing files from within CD+ list but new downloads post this update should work just fine. If you do have issues, just "Reset All Settings" in CD+ preferences.
- Fixed the pirated message some users were getting
- No longer relying on symlink for saving downloaded files. You can now save files directly into any destination of your choice and easily access them. You may experience difficulty playing existing files from within CD+. But new downloads post this update should work just fine.

- Moved Chrome Downloader+ "Preferences" inside Chrome App itself instead of showing in the settings App.
- New quick and very efficient way to handle saving and retrieving data about your downloads. Please note that for this to take effect, it will be necessary to clear CD+ existing data and preferences. However all of your downloaded files will still remain where they are saved.
- Fixed an issue where downloaded files are being randomly deleted.
- Added Arabic, French, German, Spanish languages support.
- Added option to view a downloaded file's target link with ability to open its enclosing folder
- New improvements to the media importer:
- Fixed CD+ failing to import videos.
- Artwork images are now displayed for all kinds (song, music-video, movie, TV-episode and podcast)
- Added option to enter Series/Episode details when importing as a TV show.
- Added extra icons for each available import destination for convenience.
- CD+ and all of its components are now fully migrated to ARC.
- Upgraded CD+ to using AFNetworking 2.
- CD+ is now using symlink to overcome file access deny error in iOS8. Therefore I strongly recommend that files you download via CD+ are also deleted through CD+ so you don't end up with empty links and unwanted files.
- Improved performance and stability.
- Added the much awaited download resuming.
- You can now cancel, pause and resume any download.
- Even when a download fails or you turn off your device, you can go back and resume any unfinished downloads.
- Fixed CD+ failing to download some Youtube Videos especially Vevo ones.
- Added an option to only download Audio.
- YouTube has removed 1080p mp4 videos. However I've added an option to only download the video when available.
- Added option to import multiple files to the same destination.
- Fixed the failure with google search for artwork.
- Revisited the design of the Importer with a sleek face-lift, larger artwork preview…
- Added support for iOS 8 (please note that the “Media Import” feature is very temperamental and buggy in iOS 8. I'm working on a clean fix, so please bear with me guys).
- New crisp and beautiful Retina and Retina HD icons for the new iPhone 6 Plus.
- Added an option in the Preferences to empty the downloads folder from failed downloads.
- Fixed an issue with video playback failing

- Fixed issue with Youtube video downloads no longer working.
- Enabled "Auto Detect MIME Type" in Chrome v38.0.2125.59.
- Updated to be compatible with the latest Chrome v37.0.2062.60.
- Added compatibility with "Safari Downloader+" so they can both simultaneously coexist.
- Added option to “Reset All Settings” In case of a persistent malfunction.
- Minor fixes and performance improvements.
- Added support for downloading videos from Vevo, Dailymotion and Vimeo websites besides YouTube.
- Downloading from Vevo supports 1080p and adds additional info like genre and release year to the Metadata (highly recommended).
- Revisited the video extraction method for improved performance and speed.
- Extended the functionality of the Media Importer with lots of improvements and additions. It's now a standalone app which allows you to view and import supported media from anywhere in your device into various built-in apps: Music App, Videos App, Podcasts, Photos App...
- Added UIDocument import/export support.
- Fixed the issue with google search for artwork.
- Solved the "Pirated Version" popup bug..
- Solved random crash some users were experiencing.
- Added resuming download from where it failed/cancelled.
- Changed the download finished notification to show on the status bar. - Fix failure to download YouTube videos.
- Changed the way the sliding panel with quality options is presented. it is now controlled by a convenient (iOS7) draggable button.
- Added option to switch between "YouTube" and "Files" views by clicking on the navigation's title.
- Added choice in the Preferences to switch tabs by swiping with one or two fingers.
- Fixed bug where changes to media's metadata are registered incorrectly or not saved at all.
- Added option to change file's name before you start downloading it by clicking on its label.
- Fixed issue where file names with special characters are not being saved when download is finished.
- Fixed crash when picking artwork image from Photos library.
- Added option to "Clear All" or "Delete All" downloads in one go.
- Also added option to clear/delete each file by swiping across from the the left.
- Added media import option for all supported files not just YouTube videos.
- Various design and interface tweaks and improvements.
- Updated to be compatible with the latest Chrome v32.0.1700.20
- Updated to support iOS7.
- Compiled a separate version for 64-bit A7 Chip devices to support iPhone 5S, iPad Air and iPad Mini Retina.
- Fixed various bugs which were causing Chrome to crash.
- Fresh, clean and sleek iOS7 like design: New icons, Added sliding panels, Circular progress the like of App Store, Blurred popups and many more...
- iOS7 support
- iOS7 design face lift
Compatibility update to work with latest Chrome v30.0.1599.12
